Parameters: the specific session to show data for
setSession(com.google.android.gms.fitnes.Description: Sets the session to display data for. A specific session must be set.

Parameters: the package name for the application to prefer for the intent, or null to not prefer any application
setPreferredApplication(java.lang.String.Description: Sets a preferred application to use for this intent. If the given app is installed and able to handle this intent, an explicit intent will be returned. By default, the intent will attempt to use the application which inserted the session. Use this method only to override that behavior.

Throws: if not enough data has been passed into the Builder to build a valid intent.
build().Description: Returns the built intent, which can be used with @B_android#content#Context#startActivity_E@ to launch the desired Fitness activity.

ClassDesc: Builder of intents to view If the application which inserted the session is installed on the device, it'll be preferred to handle the intent. This behavior can be overridden by @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#SessionsApi#ViewIntentBuilder#setPreferredApplication_E@. The session view intent has the following attributes: @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#Fitness#ACTION_VIEW_E@ @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#data#Session#MIME_TYPE_PREFIX_E@ followed by the activity for the session. For example, vnd.google.fitness.session/running would represent a running session. An application that would like to handle Session view intents should create an activity and add an intent filter to its manifest file.
